channel.title: Tannoyista Reviews
channel.description: Reviewing only the best in sound system equipment from the latest to vintage classics including Valve/Tube and Solid State

item.title: The Ultimate Vinyl Cleaning Machine : The Degritter Mark II Review
item.author: tannoyista.com
item.description: Back in 2010, I bought my first RCM, the machine was by Moth. Since then, I've been through more than a few and I thought they did a good job. How wrong can one be. Now, apart from having to wear ear defenders when using some of the machines, after around 6 months, the machine became more part of my cupboard, rather than a tool. Not because I didn’t want to clean my vinyl or that I wasn’t playing my vinyl, but because of the hassle, the noise and having to hide it away again afterwards.]]>

item.title: The Ranvoice Audio RV-1020 Valve Preamplifier Review
item.author: tannoyista.com
item.description: ]]>

item.title: The Classic CROFT Vitale SC Preamplifier - Upgraded
item.author: tannoyista.com
item.description: In early 2023, I decided that I'd put together a more robust balanced system, and with a new balanced amplifier on the cards coming into Tannoyista, the time was right to get a nice preamplifier sorted too.]]>

item.title: The Ultrafide audio U500DC Power Amplifier - Review
item.author: tannoyista.com
item.description: It's early 2023. And with the new year, a new amplifier has arrived at Tannoyista. And this time, it isn't valve-based. This 250wpc British-made amplifier is from a company with an excellent heritage in live sound & professional studio circles that some in the Hi-Fi world may not have heard of.]]>

item.title: The Legendary Kenwood/Trio L-07D Turntable - Review
item.author: tannoyista.com
item.description: The L-07D doesn't need any introduction to the turntable 'Hall of Fame'. Alongside the greatest Technics and J.C.Verdier decks, the L-07D stands out on par and just as remarkable. My previous turntable was Thorens TD-124 MKII which I was in position for nearly 10 years. It was fully refurbished by Schopper and the sound was sublime.]]>

item.title: The Khozmo 'Shunt Relay' Passive Preamplifier - Review
item.author: tannoyista.com
item.description: ]]>

item.title: The Entreq Tellus Infinity Line grounding box - Review
item.author: tannoyista.com
item.description: The Entreq Tellus II Infinity Line is one of the most intriguing additions to the Tannoyista system I've ever had the pleasure of owning. It has no moving parts, no mains cable and is encased in beautifully finished solid wood.]]>

item.title: The Original Trident Studios Lockwood Loudspeakers
item.author: tannoyista.com
item.description: Trident Studios was a recording studio in London. Opening in 1968, it remained open until 1981 and in that time, Trident Studios coined itself one of the most uniquely important recording studios in the world.]]>

item.title: The Sepea Audio Studer A80 Stabiliser Card - Review
item.author: tannoyista.com
item.description: The A80 stabiliser card is something you wouldn't think about upgrading. But Sepia Audio has made something really special which has to be experienced on such a legendary machine.]]>

item.title: The Studer A80 Master Tape Reel Machine - Review
item.author: tannoyista.com
item.description: The Studer A80 Master Recorder is one hell of a beast. After previously owning a Studer A807 MKII, Nagra Kudelski, Revox G36 and a Pioneer RT-909, in 2018 I wanted to revisit an old friend with whom I was familiar back in the early '90s.]]>

item.title: The Thorens TD-124 MK2 Turntable - Review
item.author: tannoyista.com
item.description: The Thorens TD-124 is one of the most classic turntables. It has a wonderful sound and a celebrated history. This review is a look back at my experience of owning the TD-124.]]>

item.title: The Air Tight ATM1 Valve Power Amplifier - Review
item.author: tannoyista.com
item.description: One amplifier which came my way in 2021 was the AirTight ATM-1. This was a remarkable little amplifier which made a big impression as part of the Tannoyista system.]]>

item.title: The Mark Grant Cables HDX1 interconnects - Review 2021
item.author: tannoyista.com
item.description: Back in 2010, I discovered that after ploughing through so many interconnect cables. The art of getting something sounding right together with robust reliability and cost differed considerably.]]>

item.title: The Pioneer PD-91 Compact Disc Player - Review 2012
item.author: tannoyista.com
item.description: The Pioneer PD-91 is considered a rare piece of equipment to own but in 2020, is it worthwhile owning such a classic piece of kit.]]>

item.title: The ALLO Revolution DAC + USBridge - Review 2020
item.author: tannoyista.com
item.description: ]]>

item.title: The SPL Volume2 Monitor Control - Review 2020
item.author: tannoyista.com
item.description: ]]>

item.title: The Funk Firm Houdini & Achromat - Review 2020
item.author: tannoyista.com
item.description: ]]>

item.title: The RECTEC M-142 Recording Monitor - Review 2019
item.author: tannoyista.com
item.description: I admit, trying to find a decent monitor preamp that filled my criteria to be on the input source of one of the best Reel to Reel machines was a task. There are plenty out there but most don't have everything you need.]]>

item.title: The ALLO Shanti Power Supply for Digital Audio - Review
item.author: tannoyista.com
item.description: With the announcement of a suited Power supply for the KATANA, the whole Allo Dac package is now totally fulfilled. I had been waiting for this for quite some time. It's now time to see what this thing can really do. I really hate using standard plug-in supplies.]]>

item.title: The VOLUMIO Primo Music Streamer - Review 2019
item.author: tannoyista.com
item.description: The Primo is the new music streamer from Volumio. From out of the box it looks very discreet.]]>

item.title: The ALLO Katana 1.2 DAC with Isolator - Review 2018
item.author: tannoyista.com
item.description: I've been using the Allo DAC products from the start and although there were some very understandable development hiccups on the way.]]>

item.title: The ROTEL RHC-10 MICHI passive preamplifier
item.author: tannoyista.com
item.description: The Rotel RHC-10 passive is something that passed me by back in the 90s. So, when this came into Tannoyista towers, it was quite surprising. At the time of this review, my Croft Epoch Elite was on its way to being upgraded by Glenn.]]>

item.title: The Tannoyista Tannoy Monitor Gold Crossover Development
item.author: tannoyista.com
item.description: This is the research and development history of the Tannoyista Tannoy Monitor Gold external crossovers by Tannoyista.]]>

item.title: ALLO Boss Audio DAC Piano, RPI, Sparky, Kali, Volt - Review
item.author: tannoyista.com
item.description: In 2016 I was using the IQAudio DAC+ for quite some time and found it to be really quite astonishing for such a small unit. It was the first DAC I used in conjunction with the Raspberry Pi. But then along came ALLO.]]>

item.title: The Tube Distinctions KT-150 Copper Valve Amplifier - Review
item.author: tannoyista.com
item.description: The Tube Distinctions Copper Amp is my current amplifier. Falling neatly in between my Croft Epoch Elite preamplifier and my 15" Tannoy Monitor Gold Lockwood Major loudspeakers, the Copper makes its presence felt.]]>

item.title: The Upgraded Croft Epoch Elite Pre-amplifier - Review 2016
item.author: tannoyista.com
item.description: The Epoch Elite was a cousin of the Croft Charisma preamplifier made by Croft in the 1990s. Glenn Croft was still involved with Eminent Audio (its marketing arm) at this stage to which that relationship eventually turned sour.]]>

item.title: The Tannoyista Tannoy Monitor Gold Crossovers - Review 2016
item.author: tannoyista.com
item.description: Designed and handmade in Great Britain, the Tannoyista crossovers give these classic Tannoy Monitor Gold loudspeakers a refreshed sound without losing their magic, uniqueness and dynamics. Each set is unique and numbered.]]>

item.title: CTS Studios Lockwood Universal Loudspeakers - Review 2012
item.author: tannoyista.com
item.description: The Tannoys are funny old things. They have a character in a very British way. With a quite focused hot spot on the treble you have a more recessed listening zone in comparison to other general kinds of speaker designs but when you're in there, man… there is no getting out.]]>

item.title: The Pioneer RT-909 Black Edition Reel to Reel
item.author: tannoyista.com
item.description: The original black version of the RT-909 was made in small numbers for the U.S military. This version is named the 'Swiss version' by Vlad Frincu, ‘the best’ update for the RT-909. This is ‘the works’, the best of.]]>

item.title: The Croft Acoustics QUAD II KT88 Amplifiers - Review 2011
item.author: tannoyista.com
item.description: The Croft modified QUAD II monoblock amplifiers in conjunction with my Tannoy Monitor Gold loudspeakers. A classic combination.]]>

item.title: CHORD CPM 2600, SPM 600 & SPA 1032 Amplifiers - Review 2009
item.author: tannoyista.com
item.description: In 2009 my amplification setup consisted of a Chord CPM2600 Integrated amplifier bi-amped with firstly an SPM600, and then the Chord SPA1032.]]>

item.title: The Michell Gyro SE Turntable - Review 2010
item.author: tannoyista.com
item.description: Back in 2010 my turntable was the Michell Gyro SE. It was to be one of my statement turntables before I migrated to the Thorens TD124 MKII. The Gyro SE is now, as was then, a legendary turntable.]]>
